title: Foundations and Practical Applications of Pharmacogenomics

context.additional_context: Practice-oriented elective course; students review pre-learning materials via LMS, complete weekly hands-on assignments, and receive peer feedback

learning_goals: Learners can explain the fundamental principles of pharmacogenomics, including gene-drug interactions and metabolic enzyme analysis.
Learners can suggest strategies for adjusting drug dosages and predicting side effects using genetic testing data.
Learners can practice patient-tailored medication prescription processes using the GeneScription simulation tool.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
